recipes.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: In a large pan, brown the ground beef over medium heat.
Add chopped onions and garlic, cook until onions are soft.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti.

recipes.name: Chicken Stir Fry
instructions: In a wok or large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat.
Add sliced chicken and cook until browned and cooked through.
Add garlic and ginger, stir for 1-2 minutes.
Add vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce and oyster sauce. Pour over the stir fry and toss to combine.
Serve over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Avocado and Egg Toast
instructions: Toast the slices of whole grain bread.
Spread mashed avocado evenly over each slice.
Top each slice with a poached egg.
Season with salt, pepper, and chili flakes if desired.

recipes.name: Greek Yogurt and Berry Parfait
instructions: In a glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt with granola and mixed berries.
Repeat the layers until the container is filled.
Drizzle honey on top.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

recipes.name: Quinoa and Black Bean Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 1 can (400g) black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes.
In a large bowl, mix cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, salsa, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture and place in a baking dish.
Top each stuffed pepper with shredded cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the peppers are tender.

recipes.name: Hummus and Veggie Platter
instructions: Arrange hummus in the center of a serving platter.
Surround the hummus with carrot sticks, cucumber slices, bell pepper strips, cherry tomatoes, and broccoli florets.
Serve as a healthy and satisfying snack.

recipes.name: Chia Seed Pudding
instructions: In a jar or bowl, mix chia seeds, almond milk, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Stir well and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight, stirring occasionally.
Top with fresh berries before serving.
Enjoy a nutritious and delicious chia seed pudding!

recipes.name: Vegetarian Quinoa Bowl
ingredients: 1 cup black beans, canned and drained
instructions: In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, avocado, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.
Season with salt and pepper, and toss gently to mix.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with lime wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Energy Bites
instructions: In a bowl, mix rolled oats, almond butter, honey, shredded coconut, chia seeds, and vanilla extract.
Fold in dark chocolate chips until evenly distributed.
Roll the mixture into bite-sized balls and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Spinach and Feta Omelette
instructions: In a bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and let them set slightly.
Add chopped spinach, feta cheese, and diced cherry tomatoes to one half of the omelette.
Fold the other half over the filling and cook until the eggs are fully set.

recipes.name: Quinoa and Chickpea Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, cucumber, bell pepper, and red onion.
Add crumbled feta cheese and toss gently.
Drizzle with olive oil, squeeze fresh lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper.
Toss again before serving.

recipes.name: Berry and Yogurt Parfait
instructions: In a glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt with granola and mixed berries.
Repeat the layers until the container is filled.
Drizzle honey on top.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

recipes.name: Banana Walnut Overnight Oats
instructions: In a jar or container, combine rolled oats, milk, mashed banana, chia seeds, and chopped walnuts.
Add maple syrup and a dash of cinnamon. Stir well to combine.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, give it a good stir and enjoy your delicious and nutritious breakfast!

recipes.name: Mango Avocado Quinoa Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, diced mango, avocado, red onion, cherry tomatoes, and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime vinaigrette dressing and toss gently to combine.
Serve chilled and enjoy this refreshing quinoa salad!

recipes.name: Cucumber Hummus Bites
instructions: Top each cucumber slice with a small spoonful of hummus.
Place a halved cherry tomato and a slice of Kalamata olive on top of the hummus.
Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley.
Secure with toothpicks and serve these delightful cucumber hummus bites!

recipes.name: Lemon Herb Grilled Chicken
instructions: In a bowl, mix lemon zest, lemon juice, minced garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Place chicken breasts in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over them.
Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill. Remove chicken from the marinade and grill until fully cooked.
Serve with your favorite side dishes.

recipes.name: Dark Chocolate Avocado Mousse
ingredients: 1/4 cup maple syrup or agave nectar
instructions: In a blender or food processor, combine ripe avocados, cocoa powder, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Chill the mousse in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Serve topped with dark chocolate shavings if desired. Enjoy this guilt-free chocolate treat!

recipes.name: Blueberry Almond Overnight Chia Pudding
instructions: In a jar or bowl, combine chia seeds, almond milk, vanilla extract, and maple syrup.
Stir well, cover, and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, give it a good stir, top with fresh blueberries and sliced almonds.
Enjoy a delightful and nutritious chia pudding for breakfast!

recipes.name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, feta cheese, olives, and parsley.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon dressing, and toss gently to combine.
Serve this refreshing Mediterranean chickpea salad for a satisfying lunch.

recipes.name: Apple Slices with Peanut Butter
instructions: Arrange apple slices on a plate.
Dip each apple slice into peanut butter.
If desired, sprinkle granola on top for added crunch.
Enjoy these quick and healthy apple slices with peanut butter as a tasty snack.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Cauliflower Fried Rice
instructions: In a large skillet, sauté carrots until softened.
Add grated cauliflower and cook until tender.
Push cauliflower to one side of the skillet and pour beaten eggs into the other side.
Scramble the eggs and mix with the cauliflower.
Stir in peas, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Cook until heated through.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve this delicious cauliflower fried rice.

recipes.name: Raspberry Chia Seed Jam
instructions: In a saucepan, heat raspberries over medium heat until they break down and become syrupy.
Stir in chia seeds and sweeten with honey or agave syrup.
Simmer until the mixture thickens, then remove from heat and let it cool.
Transfer to a jar and refrigerate. Use this raspberry chia seed jam on toast or as a topping for desserts.

recipes.name: Pineapple Coconut Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: Toppings: shredded coconut, granola, chia seeds, sliced banana
instructions: In a blender, combine frozen pineapple, banana, coconut milk, and Greek yogurt.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a bowl and add toppings like shredded coconut, granola, chia seeds, and sliced banana.
Enjoy this tropical pineapple coconut smoothie bowl for a refreshing breakfast.

recipes.name: Caprese Skewers
instructions: Thread a cherry tomato, a mozzarella ball, and a basil leaf onto each wooden skewer.
Arrange the skewers on a serving platter.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze just before serving.
Enjoy these delightful Caprese skewers as a light and flavorful snack!

recipes.name: Yogurt and Berry Popsicles
instructions: In a blender, blend Greek yogurt, mixed berries, and honey or maple syrup until smooth.
Pour the mixture into popsicle molds.
Insert popsicle sticks and freeze for at least 4 hours or until solid.
Enjoy these refreshing yogurt and berry popsicles as a healthy snack.

recipes.name: Salmon and Asparagus Foil Packets
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place each salmon fillet on a piece of foil large enough to fold over and seal.
Divide asparagus and lemon slices among the packets.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Drizzle over each packet.
Seal the foil packets and bake for 15-20 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through.
Garnish with fresh dill before serving.

recipes.name: Chocolate Avocado Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, mix mashed avocados, maple syrup, eggs, and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together whole wheat flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients, then fold in dark chocolate chips.
Spoon the batter into muffin cups and bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
